summary: This document is a financial record from Deutsche Bank outlining the terms under which they will accept trading instructions via electronic media from clients, specifically mentioning Jeffrey Epstein. It highlights the risks associated with such transactions and requires client acknowledgment of these terms.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned as a client in the context of trading instructions and the acknowledgment of terms set by Deutsche Bank.

persons.name: Branca Sooniora
persons.context: Branca Sooniora is identified as the Client Advisor who is facilitating the agreement with Jeffrey Epstein regarding trading instructions.

persons.name: Zbynek Kozeisky
persons.context: Zbynek Kozeisky is mentioned as another Client Advisor involved in the agreement process with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Paul Barrett
persons.context: Paul Barrett is mentioned as a Client Advisor who is involved in the approval process of the trading instructions.

Paul Barrett is a Client Advisor who is part of the approval process for Jeffrey Epstein's trading instructions.

keyFacts: The document outlines the terms under which Deutsche Bank will accept trading instructions via electronic media.
Jeffrey Epstein is specifically mentioned as a client in this agreement.
The document emphasizes the risks associated with electronic trading instructions.
Client Advisors Branca Sooniora, Zbynek Kozeisky, and Paul Barrett are involved in the agreement process.
